dmca.title: DMCA Notification - ISP Letter - turbocharger-parts.com/Autometer
dmca.body:
________________________________

From: Victor Tarver [mailto:vtarver@netenforcers.com] 
Posted At: Monday, November 13, 2006 4:27 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: DMCA Notification - ISP Letter - turbocharger-parts.com/Autometer
Subject: DMCA Notification - ISP Letter - turbocharger-parts.com/Autometer



The Planet,

 

Please read carefully.  The infringing website, turbocharger-parts.com, has been
sent a separate cease and desist letter via certified postal mail and should be
receiving it shortly.  Thank you.

 

 

Victor Tarver

LMS Representative

Net Enforcers Inc.

VTarver@netenforcers.com 

compliance.management@netenforcers.com 

 

The Online Enforcement Specialists......

Statement of Confidentiality

The contents of this e-mail message and any attachments are confidential and are
intended solely for the addressee.  The information may also be legally privileged. 
This transmission is sent in trust, for the sole purpose of delivery to the intended
recipient.  If you have received this transmission in error, any use, reproduction
or dissemination of this transmission is strictly prohibited.  If you are not the
intended recipient, please immediately notify the sender by reply e-mail  and delete
this message and its attachments, if any. Thank you.

 

 

                                                                                                                                      

11/14/2006

7005 1160 0002 6996 0765

VIA CERTIFIED US MAIL

RETURN RECEIPT REQUESTED


Designated Agent

ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.

George Poletes

1333 North Stemmons Freeway Suite 110

Dallas TX 75207

 

 

Re:  Unauthorized Use of CLIENT'S Trademarks and/or Copyrighted Materials

Dear Designated Agent:

This office is authorized to act on behalf of Autometer in this matter.

This letter is to provide you notice pursuant to 17 U.S.C.
